data.title: Great !
data.text: Great place to stop in for a quick hot dog or brat. Limited off street parking,  and street parking is often full.  Popular place for both lunch and dinner.  No inside seating, and limited outside table seating.

data.title: Great place !
data.text: Small hotdog stand on a corner and you'd probably drive right by it if it weren't for all the cars and trucks parked around it.  On street parking isn't very convenient, but the hot dogs and sausages they serve make up for that.

data.title: Hot dogs
data.text: If your ever in Vegas, its worth the 20 min drive to go get a hot dog from Hot Dog Heaven in Henderson!! They use poppy seed buns from Chicago and the franks are delicious!!!! I would skip Pinks on the strip to drive to this place that's been in business for 21 years....for a reason!

data.title: Customer service rates at a #2
data.text: Went over with a craving to get food from hotdog heaven which is always on the butt but when we got there it was 5:45

data.title: The Hot Dog Nazi is alive and well!
data.text: If you like Chicago style hot dogs you won't be disappointed.  If you were entertained by Jerry Seinfeld's Soup Nazi you will be entertained by the Hot Dog Nazi!  I won't forget my stop at Hot Dog Heaven any time soon.:)

data.title: Roadside Madness
data.text: Just like you remember from the good old days.  A hot dog stand on the side of the road and all they sell is hot dogs and drinks.  And they do them right because that's all they do!

data.title: On the corner of delicious and charming!
data.text: Quality dogs, decent prices and a great experience for a small biz. Locals appreciate grabbing some eats here and watching traffic pass by!

data.title: Great Lunch to  Go
data.text: Some of the best hot dogs and sausages with fries in the Las Vegas area.  Convenient location for pick-up.  If you like dogs this place is a must!

data.title: Chicago Beef like Johnny's Elmwood Park
data.text: True Chicago food.  Made by Chicago people.  I grew up with Johnny's in the old green building in the 60's.  Joe and his crew got it for real.  Enjoy your beef , hot & sweet. Dog loaded.   Chi town folks know what I'm talking about.

data.title: A little piece of Chicago in Henderson NV
data.text: This is just a little stand that you walk up to and order your food.  They have a couple of outside tables to eat your food but most people just take it home as the tables are quite basic and right on Lake Mead boulevard so there's lots of traffic going by.  We love their beef sandwiches, which taste like being back in Chicago.  The menu is basically hot dogs, beef sandwiches, fries and drinks.  If you are missing true Chicago food, you will like Hot Dog Heaven.

data.title: HOT DOG HELL
data.text: Vienna dogs with everything on them - 3 stars - nothing to write home about. In fact too small for their $3 price.  French fries were better than most. - 4 stars. However. The owner's angry berating foul mouth cursing of a person who sat at one of the three tables who had not yet purchased a hot dog really soured the experience. This was done as he yelled past me, over my shoulder while I am at the window to order - priceless. No amount of great food or great former reputation can make up for their inhospitable unbelievably terrible bungling of this situation. Turned out others in the shack new the guy. That guy and my guests and myself will never be back to HOT DOG HELL,

data.title: A hot dog stand just like Chicago
data.text:
Great Chicago food.  Of course Chicago style hot dogs.  If you haven't had a Chicago style Italian beef or sausage sandwich try one here..

This is a take out place.  One or two picnic tables available outside.

data.title: Taste of Heaven!
data.text: I used to frequent Hot Dog Heaven after bike rides around Lake Mead, and after moving away, I sure missed my Sunday hot dog. This spring, my husband and I returned to the area for vacation and stopped by for chili dogs and fries; they were amazing, as always! There's nothing like one of their hot dogs to satisfy your post-ride hunger...

data.title: Will stop here again!
data.text:
This was the best freaking Italian sausage with peppers I have ever had.  These guy are straight out of Chicago and really know how to cook a dog.  One tip... CASH ONLY!

Had to walk to walgreens to get cash.  no debit or credit cards

data.title: Old School Food
data.text: This tiny walk-up window hot dog stand is always a good choice for a quick lunch in Henderson. There is no inside seating but there are picnic tables out front and a stand-up counter. They are a "cash only" place so be aware before you pull out your plastic. The hot dogs are wonderful whether you choose their Chicago dog with the works or the chili dog and the fries are the best in the entire valley. The owner can sound rude at times but ignore that and enjoy the fresh good food. Oh, and don't call it a Coney Dog or you will get the lecture on New York vs Chicago. This guy reminds me of the Soup Nazi on Seinfeld!

data.title: Hot Dog Heaven is a must!
data.text: Pull right up, park and place your order at the walk up window. The franks they use are great quality and the fries are made the old fashion way. Outstanding taste and many ways to fix up your dog. Chili and Onion please1

data.title: Best Chicago Food in Las Vegas/Henderson NV
data.text:
This little stop on the side of the road in Henderson is well worth the drive if you are like me and really like Chicago hotdogs.  The owner is a bit gruff but it is part of the charm.  I've tried every hotdog place in town and nothing compares to this.

87 Lake Mead; Henderson NV 89015

data.title: Typical Hot Dog Stand
data.text:
Hot Dog Heaven is over-rated by the locals. Perhaps it's because there aren't many hot dog stands in the major cities of Nevada. My sausage sandwich was flooding with grease (I like grease) and I was only given two tiny napkins total after asking for more. Hot Dog Heaven has no indoor seating and a minimum of outdoor seating.
It's not a "hot dog heaven".

data.title: RUDE SERVICE!!
data.text:
Went here for lunch today and decided to get my food and leave!! After being interrupted while trying to order so the guy could shout at another customer his order was ready, he also rudely told me he couldn't take my order until my daughter would stop leaning on the order bar.. She's 8 yrs old and was just standing in line like the rest of us!! He kept saying "are you done"," is that it"? After waiting in the heat (since there is only 3 outside tables with no umbrellas in total) he then threw the food bags out the window..
The food is no where good enough to endure this type of behavior! Same food you could get at Sonic for half the price...
Will NOT be going here again!

data.title: Horrible Experience
data.text: My husband, daughter and I stopped by for lunch on a recent Saturday.  I placed an order for 3 hot dogs and fries (nothing special).  Since it was pretty crowded, I figured we'd have to wait a few minutes.  25 minutes later (after folks who ordered after us got their food), my husband said to the guy at the counter "we ordered awhile ago and were wondering if you know how much longer it'll be."  The guy says, "It takes as long as it takes. You probably have a special order and now you're going to have to go to the end of the line because you asked."  I thought he was just joking, but when we tried to explain that we hadn't ordered anything special, he started shouting at us that we had to wait.  So we waited another 7-8 minutes and saw more people who ordered after us get their food.  When we asked again, the guy starts looking for our order and then looks at us and says, "I don't have your order."  He said it three times and kept looking at us like we were lying about having placed an order.  He had our receipt in his hand, with the date and time on it!  Still trying to be polite, my husband said, "Well, how much longer will it be?"  The guy starts yelling at my husband and calling him a "wise guy" and telling him that he wasn't going to serve us and we needed to "get lost."  My husband is a really mellow guy (1st time in 20 years of marriage I’ve seen him lose his temper), but he started shouting at the guy because he wouldn’t listen to us.  I finally stepped in and asked for our money back (shorted us 41 cents) and got the heck out of there.  I really hope this guy wasn't the owner, but I have a sneaking suspicion he is.  Scary.
